result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith S. Gary

records.addlTxt: deceased party

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keith S. Gary in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Keith S. Gary in custody.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  State states agreement reached.  Atty Raabe enters Guilty plea to Ct 1.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Atty Raabe states DE wishes to not have a PSI completed but requests plea/sent be set out about 5 weeks to gather some records prior to sentencing.  State takes no position.  Court orders PSI be completed.  Atty Raabe notes there was a 58 page federal PSI completed recently and requests the court simply review that instead of doing a new one.  Court notes he'd be interested in that and thinks the DOC would be too.  State has no objection but notes it wouldn't include the victim impact information specific to this case.  Court orders PSI be completed no later than 7/25/2016.  Bond continued pending sentencing.  Atty Raabe requests bond in 14CF184 be returned to poster.  Court notes that will be returned as that case has been dismissed.

15CF181
Ct 1:  Guilty
Cts 2 and 3:  Dismissed/read-in

14CF184:  Dismissed/read-in  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Columbia Co. Correctional
Final pre-trial on May 23, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Keith S. Gary in court with attorney Adam Raabe, special appearance.  Defendant Keith S. Gary in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not retained on this case, making special appearance today.  Attorney Short not available today.  Matter to be reset.  Defendant advises Attorney Raabe that Attorney Short does not represent.  Defendant request to proceed pro se.  State request reset of trial as well.  Attorney Short to be advised of status of representation.  Defendant objects to any delay.  Bond continues.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Keith S. Gary in court with attorney Dennis Joseph Ryan.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Ryan acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial.  Bond continued.
Arraignment on September 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Keith S. Gary in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  John Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls Officer Andrew Foesch, sworn & testifies.  Reedsburg PD.  Certified law enf. officer.  Testifies as to allegations in the complaint.  Defendant identified.  Attorney Klopp cross examines.  State objects to discoverable examination.  Court sustained.  Attorney Klopp continues.  No further testimony.  State request bind over.  Attorney Klopp objects to bind over.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.  Attorney Klopp request argn date. Information filed.  Attorney Klopp received copy of Information.  Bond continues.  Arraignment scheduled for September 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Keith S. Gary by video from LEC with attorney Stanley V Woodard.  Defendant Keith S. Gary in custody.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  Defense waives reading of complaint.  State requests $5,000 cash bond.  Atty Woodard responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $2,500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o valid prescription.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
